Mostly clear PERIOD Low near 35F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm



The Purdue womens basketball team used a fast paced offense and bench scoring to distance themselves from Penn State Thursday night PERIOD

The Boilers   Big Ten scored a seasonhigh  points in their  win over the Nittany Lions   in Happy Valley Penn PERIOD Coach Sharon Versyp said she changed her lineup to jump start the team and the offense freshman forward Samantha Woods and junior guard Lauren Mioton started the game PERIOD

 Versyp said in a pregame radio conference on the Purdue Radio Network PERIOD 

Part of that energy came from KiKi Freeman who was kept out of the starting lineup for the first time on the season PERIOD Freeman played  minutes with  points and four rebounds PERIOD Assistant coach Jody Benner said in a postgame radio conference that Freeman got the message PERIOD

 Benner said PERIOD 

Throughout the game the Boilers worked on defense to prevent easy baskets and shut out Penn State when it came to fastbreak points PERIOD Meanwhile Purdue was able to capitalize and score six points on the run PERIOD

Eight of the nine Boilers who played in the game scored with the exception being junior guard Lauren Mioton who made her first start in over a month but played just  minutes PERIOD Senior guard Kalika France had  points in  minutes PERIOD Junior forward Danielle Campbell added a team high  points PERIOD

The Boilers will now look to break their  game win one lose one rhythm at  p.m PERIOD Sunday in Mackey Arena against Northwestern PERIOD
